title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message:
Original issue was laptop won't power on with MagSafe. Replace U7100 to correct this issue.

With the battery plugged in, the MagSafe flashes (long green, then short green, then repeat). Laptop powers up still and runs, but battery won't charge. Runs fine with only battery or MagSafe, but once both a connected, the blinking starts. 

I've replaced U7100 x2 to confirm not defective. Current sensing resistors measured good and traces to U7100 also good. 

Once i turn the board off, it comes back on once the MagSafe cycles through the blinks. What what i can tell, data is being sent through SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Try another battery first....

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: I've tried 2 different batteries with the same result.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Check Q7155 maybe is shorted...

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Q7155 isn't short, but measured approx. 72ohms on pins 1/2/3. Isolated the low resistance to the PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS line. Wondering, is the normal resistance for this line as the board boots up to OS with no issue, either with battery or with magsafe, and with both (except with the MagSafe blinking)?

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Q7180 is a good suspect. Also check resistance between pins 17/18 27/28 on U7100. Is PPBUS present with charger only and what voltage?

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: PPBUS is 20v with charger only and 11v with batt only. Pin 17/18 @ 3.4ohm, 27/28 @ 11ohm

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: 20V is way to high. Q7130/35 and U7100 should all be replaced at the same time. PPBUS should be 12.6V.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Ok thanks. Out of both trans. Will update once parts arrives and installed.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Thanks again guys. Replaced both trans, as i had previously replaced U7100. Fixed and now running as expected.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Well, power issue is resolved. Now got this weird issue where the display doesn't come on until its completely loaded the os, i close the screen to put it in sleep mode, then open the screen before the screen starts to work.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Wrong 2014 model LCD assembly installed. 2015 and newer are different LCD.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Original LCD. Also it was running normally before the transistor replacement, back when I could only power up with either charger or battery and not both. Looking around the transistor area (q7130/35), top and bottom of board.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Is there a way to tell what model display is currently installed?

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: remove the clutch cover, unscrew the display PCB from the case and you will see the model on the PCB...

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Thanks. Confirmed, the display (LP154WT2) is for the mid2015 which is what this laptop is.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Do a PRAM reset and test with a known good LCD assembly. Also inspect around LCD connector for knocked off parts.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Same result. Even HDMI isn't working, and doesn't work even after i wake the laptop from sleep and the display starts to work.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: HDMI never works or only after sleep?

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: never works, even after waking the laptop from sleep. Only the display comes on after sleep.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: That may point to the GPU not working and only using the Intel onboard. Check voltages on the GPU Vcore and for damaged parts around it. Is the GPU still recognized in OSX?

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message:
No Title

I'll do the measurements during the weekend. Going out town. And yes, the GPU is still recognized in OSX, Believe this model is only has the intel Iris pro. Serial number is: C02Q74K6G8WM

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Its the 2.8GHz, 16GB version.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: 00163 board has an AMD GPU and that is missing now. Check voltages around the GPU fist. You must have knocked something off/damaged.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: That’s my thought also, that I knocked something off. Will check once I get back in town.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: looks like the gpu is toast. PPVCORE_GPU shorted to ground (mostly, 0.63ohms). Pulled R9398 and R9399 and confirmed short is on GPU side. Going to pull all 30 caps to confirm issue isn't with one of the caps. don't know of any other way to confirm the short on the gpu without pulling the gpu.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: No need to pull the caps, GPU is dead. Do confirm with another board if you have one to be sure. But GPU Vcore is usually around 3-6 Ohm.

title: 820-00163, MagSafe flashing green light when battery is plugged in.
message: Yep. Thanks for the assist
